Wednesday 2nd November 2011
Curriculum Information
Dear Parents,
As announced to you earlier in the school year, the Secondary Department will no longer be sending home a weekly blurb containing curriculum information. This blurb will now be replaced with a far more detailed curriculum letter. Attached to this letter is the curriculum information for all subjects for the remainder of this Autumn Term. In January a new curriculum letter will go home containing information for the Spring Term and a final letter will go home in April with details for the Summer Term.
If you have any questions pertaining to the information contained in this curriculum letter, please speak to the individual teachers at our parent teacher conferences over the next two weeks.
Kind regards
Mrs. Hamilton
Key Stage Three Phase Leader

PE
Netball/ Fitness Testing Pupils will continue to develop their understanding of the Principles of Play by taking part in Netball. Pupils will develop technical skills such as passing, shooting and key movement skills to allow them to be an effective performer in Netball. They will practice and refine the chest pass, bounce pass and overhead pass which will allow them to transfer into game situations. Pupils will discover why we use each pass in different situations and begin to make correct decisions in match play. Pupils will recall the key points that make up B.E.E.F (Balance, Eyes, Elbow, Follow through) which will allow them to analyse their own and others shooting technique. Key movement practices and techniques will also be developed through a variety of practices, allowing the pupils to put their skills into game situations whilst following the correct rules of Netball. As well as skills, pupils will be given ample opportunity to develop strategic and tactical thinking relating to the principles of play. These thinking skills will allow the pupils to transfer them across all invasion games. Towards the end of this term, pupils will take part in a variety of fitness tests. This will allow them to identify their strengths and weaknesses and suggest ways in which they can improve. All tests will be retaken in term two and three. Key Skills: -Passing – Chest, Bounce, Overhead -Receiving – Catching, Body position -Shooting – B.E.E.F -Movement – Footwork, attacking fakes and dodges, with the ball -Tactics and Strategies – Principles of play in attack and defense.
